I'd like to buy the product. Based on the 3 high-quality products out of 9 sold, I'll use Bayes' theorem to update the probability of the product being high-quality. The prior probability of a product being high-quality is 33.33%, and the prior probability of a product being low-quality is 66.67%. With 3 high-quality products out of 9 sold, the updated probability of the product being high-quality is (3/9) / (3/9 + 6/9) = 3/9 / 9/9 = 1/3. I'll buy the product.
